title: [BUG] samples/Basic/iOS/SkiaSharpSample canvas.DrawText cannot convert arguments
body:
### Description

To start with an iOS SkiaSharp example that matches what I would do as a nuget user, I modified samples/Basic/iOS/SkiaSharpSample/SkiaSharpSample.csproj:
* target net8-ios and iOS 13.0.
* Instead of referencing source projects, add nugets SkiaSharp, SkiaSharp.Views, SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.iOS 2.88.8

When build, ViewController.cs, OnPaintSurface line 41 `canvas.DrawText(...)` can't find a match for parameter types:
* Argument 3: cannot convert from Skiasharp.SKTextAlign to float.
* Argument 2: cannot convert from SkiaSharp.SKPoint to float.


### Code

```cs
canvas.DrawText("SkiaSharp", coord, SKTextAlign.Center, font, paint);
```


### Expected Behavior

The project builds and runs on an iOS 17.2 simulator.


### Actual Behavior

Compile errors mentioned above.

I can probably fix this. But posting issue in case
* there is some other nuget I should have included to handle iOS type conversions,
* or the sample matches some preview version I have not tried,
* or the sample needs to be updated.

### Version of SkiaSharp

2.88.3 (Current)

### Last Known Good Version of SkiaSharp

Other (Please indicate in the description)

### IDE / Editor

Visual Studio (Windows)

### Platform / Operating System

iOS

### Platform / Operating System Version

VS 2022 17.9.7 connected to iOS 17.2 Simulator on Mac.

comments.author: ToolmakerSteve
comments.body:
Using a different overload gets past this error:

`canvas.DrawText("SkiaSharp", coord.X, coord.Y, font, paint);`

However the text is no longer centered in the screen:  
The text starts at screen center.

Text alignment parameter is added in a preview version?  
Or iOS support is outdated?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
If you want to use the 2.x series of NuGet packages, you need to pull the sample from the `release/2.x` branch: https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/release/2.x/samples/Basic/iOS/SkiaSharpSample/ViewController.cs

Let me know if this helps.
